text: snow skin moon cakes have taken the moon
cake world by storm
with the slightly chewy soft and tender
skin and sweet feelings snow skin
mooncakes are so pretty to look at and
quite easy to make compared to the
traditional one with golden brown pastry
let's see how we can make this at home
let's begin
for the snow skin you will need powdered
sugar rice flour glutinous rice flour
cornstarch milk vegetable oil and some
food color of your choice please wash
until the end to get all the
measurements of the ingredients for the
fillings you will need mung beans sugar
glutinous rice flour salt mentos or
glucose syrup vegetable oil and some
water we will make the fillings first
soak the peel split mung beans in water
for one hour rinse well combine the mung
beans in a saucepan with water bring to
a boil and skim up the form when the
beans are cooked add sugar stir to
dissolve and then blend until smooth
in a small bowl combine the glutinous
rice flour with the vegetable oil stir
well to combine transfer the beans
mixture to a non-stick pan cook over
medium-high heat to reduce occasionally
stirring when it starts bubbling and
some of the liquid has evaporated add
the glutenous dry flour and oil mixture
also add the mantels and stir well cook
over low heat constantly stirring for
about 30 to 45 minutes until the mung
beans come together a paste and doesn't
stick to the pan on the spatula anymore
when you pinch a piece of the fillings
it can stay in its form and doesn't melt
down it's the right time to take off the
heat do not cook any further otherwise
the filling is going to be too dry
transfer the filling to a plate cover
with a piece of serrang wrap so it
doesn't dry out and poke some holes to
release the stem
leave to cool while we move on to make
other parts of the moon cake
toss the salted egg yolk with some
cooking wine and rinse again a few times
under running water arrange on a baking
twilight with parchment paper brush with
some sesame oil and bake in an oven at
135 degrees celsius for about 10 minutes
to make the crust for the snow skin
firstly combine the powdered sugar milk
and vegetable oil in a bowl
combine the rice flour glutinous rye
flour and corn starch and sift into the
mixture stir really well to combine and
leave to sit for about 30 minutes then
divide the mixtures into three equal
portions traditional snow skin moon cake
comes in white color and hence the name
snow but i will add some color to the
other two to make it more colorful and
exciting cover with plastic wrap and
leave a small gap for the steam to come
out you can steam the dough for about 25
to 30 minutes or put it into a microwave
for just 45 seconds to one minute after
a minute remove and stir well then cover
and put it back into a microwave for
another one minute then take out and
stir well again when you no longer see
the opaque white color of the raw flour
that's when it's cooked leave it to cool
down a little then we can start
assembling the mooncake for a hundred
gram mooncake i will use 60 gram of the
fillings and 40 gram of the skin make
the fillings into a bowl and flatten it
out into a disk place the sauteed egg
yolk in the center to simplify the moon
then pinch to seal and make it into a
nice bowl for dusting we will cook some
glutinous rye flour in a clean dry pan
over medium low heat for about six to
seven minutes when you have a taste and
the flour easily melts in your mouth and
no longer taste unpleasantly of raw
flour is done dust this flour on the
working surface transfer the cooked
dough onto this flour surface and it
well for about a minute it feels so good
because the dough is really soft and
smooth roll it out into a thin disc
place the fillings into the center and
pinch the edges together coat the mold
with a thin layer of the cooked
glutinous rye flour and shake off the
excess place the ball inside the mold
and press down slightly and the more
exciting part of all is to unmold look
at that
so pretty isn't it continue this process
until you assembled all the moon cakes
the sampling part is always so much fun
so get your kids involved and share
these beautiful memories of moon cake
making to celebrate meat autumn festival
together this snow skin moon cakes will
taste the best when chilled for a few
hours in the refrigerator the moon cakes
have super smooth soft and slightly
chewy skin the fillings is quite creamy
soft and equally smooth blending so well
with the savory flavor of the salted egg
yolk such a wonderful bite to celebrate
the miss autumn festival this is the
exact measurements of all the
ingredients so capture the screen and
have all the ingredients ready then you
can make snow skin moon cake in no time
good luck and have a happy meal autumn
festival everyone see you in the next
video bye
[Music]
you
